page.title: 07PARK HALL
page.content: Park Hall was built in the 19th century.It was owned by the Marquis of Hertford.During the war it became Government owned.It was used for a hostel for the land army girls.After the war the B.B.C bought it.They found it was not suitable so they sold Park Hall and moved to Woodnorton, near Evesham.Espley Tyas bought it and developed it as their building construction company headquarters. There are about 30 to 40 offices spread over 3 floors.The work Espley Tyas carried out at Park Hall was planning, buying,management and accounts. Espley Tyas did some building in Salford Priors and were responsible for building Long Lartin Maximum Security Prison.Park Hall and the grounds cover about 4 acres.Espley Trust is now leaving Park Hall as the company has gone into liquidation.
